Author: FragMasterMat117

Comment: This is a good article when he was contemplating running again.   One comment Durbin made was: >Durbin, 80, acknowledged last week it’s a difficult decision for an eight-year commitment that includes two years of campaigning and six years on the job. And a person close to the senator told Playbook that only two people know which way Durbin will decide: “The senator and his wife, Loretta.”  It's not just his current age, it's the campaigning and serving.  Only if Senator Grassley who is 91 had the same logic and instead woul just hang out with his great, great grandkids, eating ice cream and watching the corn grow.  He seems to like to post updates on corn growth so he'll still be a part of the farming community that way.   The Late Senator Dianne Feinstein of CA was born the same year - fact her passing away and them working together as collegues for so long on the Judiciary Senate committee shows how stubborn he is, in addition to Iowa voting him back in.
Author: Brief_Amicus_Curiae
